article:
In sailing, an 'extra' is a sail that is not part of the working sail plan.

The most common extra is the spinnaker. Other extras include studding sails, the
modern spanker (or tallboy), and some staysails and topsails.

In yacht racing, there are often separate divisions depending on whether or not
extras are permitted. A race or division in which extras are not permitted is
commonly called a non spinnaker, or no flying sails, race or division.
